website_summaries.verdict: Although it’s a pricier dry dog food, its large crunchy bites of bumpy chicken nugget-like kibble is surprisingly effective at cleaning a dog’s mouth.
pros: Crunchy kibble texture considerably reduces built-up tartar
Excellent for dogs of all ages and sizes

website_summaries.verdict: If your dog is swallowing their dental-health food whole, these huge chunks are guaranteed to force any canine to chew their way to clean teeth.
pros: Especially large chunky pieces promote chewing behavior, allowing this food to dramatically reduce plaque and tartar buildup
cons: May be too large for the smallest breeds to handle

customer_reviews.title: Happy Chihuahuas Happy Mom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my chihuahua She is 1 1/2 and weighs 6 pounds I brush her teeth but wanted to add to her dental care so after researching I decided to buy science diet oral care. I've always fed my dogs science diet . I still feed her her regular food I just give her less and add a couple pieces of the oral care. She loves it. I was surprised when my 3 pound chihuahua was able to eat the nuggets as well. I was also happy. She's 12 years old and having issues with her teeth because she won't let me brush her teeth. I will update the results
customer_reviews.author: JLTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very Big Pieces - But My Chiweenie Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: The miniature dachshund on the bag is a bit misleading, as the pieces of dog food were MUCH larger than I was anticipating. To the point where I'm scared to leave her food out whenever I'm not home, as I'm scared that she could choke on it. She seems to like this food better than her old food, but I think my Chiweenie just thinks they're treats. I will continue to give her this food until it's gone and see if there are any issues. Other than the size of the dog food, I think it's great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amber G

customer_reviews.title: Size really doesn’t matter
customer_reviews.text: First off I don’t write reviews but.....I just received the oral care food. My doxies are small and they are getting old. The oldest is 17 with really bad breath despite cleaning his teeth. I just received these and they are like nuggets and I ordered the small bag just to try. We only give them Science Deit so I felt confident that they won’t get diarrhea or side effects. When I opened it today they attacked these like they were candy. Even the 17 year old is not minding the size. I’ll update later when I see if there breath and teeth changed. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce S. Cronce

customer_reviews.title: Product offered in 28.5 pound bag may be a "second" - something not sold on main market
customer_reviews.text: The "bites" are varying sizes compared to the original 4 pound bag of this same dog food. Some of the "bites" are twice the size of others and all are a lighter color than the first bag I got. The expiration is not until Dec 2020 but the food seems dried out much more and much much harder for my dog to chew. While I have opened the bag and used two days or so I will be calling Amazon to discuss a return/refund and then buy the 4 pound bag assuming it will have a fresher product and more consistent sized "bites"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less messy than dog biscuits, and double as a "toy"
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Kirkland dog biscuits for years, when my dogs need a snack between meals. However, I adopted a large dog a year ago, and he mostly just mangles the biscuits, leaving a mess on the floor and around his jowls. My vet has these in a large jar for treats, and my dogs really like them, so I bought a bag for home use. These balls make a perfect replacement, since they fit entirely in the dog's mouth = no mess. Also, you can roll them on the floor for chasing, or pitch them for a "mouth catch", getting both snack and playtoy in one. They are a bit more expensive (30%+/-) than the Kirkland biscuits.
customer_reviews.author: Freitag

customer_reviews.title: Good For Dogs Teeth
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular dog food (Hill's Science Diet Adult Oral Care Chicken) because of the larger kibbles. My 9-year-old, 16-pound Schnauzer mix would just wolf down the smaller kibbles so fast and look for more. Now she takes one kibble at a time, to her "special treat" spot. I noticed she takes her time chewing the larger kibbles and they seem to satisfy her, because she doesn't come looking for more when her bowl is empty. My Vet says her teeth are looking great, so I do feel the larger kibbles keep her teeth much cleaner due to all the chewing she has to do. I will continue to buy this dog food.
customer_reviews.author: gr8gramma of 13

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it like a treat and it cleans their teeth too.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this product so much that I can pass off this huge chunks as treats. Because the product only comes in one size chunks and it does help clean their teeth I take the bag of this and mix it with my dogs regular dog food. This way my dogs get the teeth cleaning help and it doesn’t break my budget. The product doesn’t come in huge bags, actually I’ve only been able to find the 4lb and 8lb bag. (At least I think that’s the size) I’ve found buying Science Diet Oral Care is not carried in all pet stores so buying it on Amazon is not only convenient but usually has the best price too.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: Love this dog food!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was using Science Diet puppy formula for a while. We finally moved him off of that and put him on this because he had some tooth discoloring. While this isn't magical and won't just perfectly get your dogs teeth white, it does work. I've seen a reasonable improvement with his teeth. But what I really like is that since we moved him to this food, he's filled out and seems even more healthy. His coat and health were always fine, but he seems to have gained a few extra healthy pounds from this food and just looks great. I really love this food and will be continuing to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Arok5

customer_reviews.title: worked with our dachshunds
customer_reviews.text: Our dachshunds had terrible breath. We started serving them Hill's Science Diet Adult Oral Care Dog Food, Chicken Rice & Barley Recipe Dry Dog Food for dental health. This dog food worked and now their breath is pleasant. The kibble is big and hard so we soak the kibbles in water for several hours before serving as our dachshunds are seniors. They show no sign of digestion issues and they like the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: We have two fussy chihuahua’s When it comes to food. However, this food seems to be like their favorite treat. I have to cut them in half due to the size of the kibble. Our chihuahua’s Eat them down without hesitation. I could not believe how much they enjoy the food. We give it to them at night. About five to six kibbles cut in half for each one of them. I only wish they came a little smaller so Cutting in half would not be necessary. We have noticed a big difference in the teeth being cleaner and breath being better as well.
customer_reviews.author: Trailwinder50

customer_reviews.title: Great Food, Very Palatable, Dogs LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I run a dog boading/day care business, we put this food in a bowl on our front counter for people to use as a treat for their dog when they come in. The dogs LOVE this food and always eat it. We used to put regular dog biscuits out but half the dogs would spit them out, with the Hills Oral Care food the dogs jump up on the counter and try to get to the treat bowl!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very large pieces- possible choking warning- for very small mouth dogs-
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for overall rating- however- these are very large pieces - Not for a Nikki"""6 pd Yorkie with small mouth-So, I broke several pieces up in a napkin-Tekko a 10 pd Yorkie loves the flavor- He eat Science diet everyday - But I thought as a maybe once a day, treat, I'd buy a different flavor- a somewhat large size for treats--But not this big --- I'd be afraid either Yorkie would choke- So that was my reasoning for breaking the bites up- making several treats- Nikki s a 3 year old, he needs more than bushing his teeth care- Hope this works as a dental helper-Tekko is 14 moths but hates his tooth brush-
customer_reviews.author: GrannyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 pound Pomeranian. These kibbles are big but she eats them just fine. Just had a dental last July. 2 months after dental her teeth need another. I spend hundreds of dollars on teeth products. Even crap fellow dog groomers recommended. Nothing works. This works!! After a month the tarter build up on her teeth is down by 50%. Her breath smells better and her gums looking great. Even the vet was surprised! We canceled her cleaning. My dog actually loves them. I give them to her as treats. If you have issues like I did with teeth this is the must get! Trust me. I’ve tried so many things.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: I use these as dog treats
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 lb and 18 lb dog and use these are their every day treats. Helps clean their teeth and I don't have to worry about giving them so many treats that they don't eat their food because this is formulated as an every meal food, they just think they are getting a treat. For their really good boy treats I dehydrate chicken hearts that I buy for cheap from the grocery and it helps them get they organ meat most dog foods don't get enough of in their formula.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by vet for teeth
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommends this. I have a Jack Russell mix so she isn’t that big. But the large kibble is supposed to be very good for her teeth. She does just fine with it. (Although she likes to take one piece and walk to wherever we are in the house, even upstairs, eat it and go back for another. So weird.)
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: The only downside is that she still has her usual sweet and wonderful (not) puppy breath
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. She has a bit of a chipped enammel (we don't know if its a birth deffect or something happened during her puppy years) so we've been very careful with her teeth and have been fighting to keep them clean. Brushing was our first option but she's not a fan. After putting her on this food for about a month, we noticed that the plac build up had significantly decreased (more than brushing ever did). I thought "oral care" sounded gimmicky but it really does work. The only downside is that she still has her usual sweet and wonderful (not) puppy breath.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Sue

customer_reviews.title: Too much grains & byproducts
customer_reviews.text: Horrible ingredients if your dog has skin or digestive allergies. Lots of grain & byproducts. I suppose it would be all right to give as treats. Vet recommended? Not by mine. My dog’s itching and skin reacted horribly due to the vast amounts of corn & wheat. Smells terrible! I kept thinking she pooped in the house only to find out it was the food in the bowl. If it smelled bad in the bowl, the poop was worse. I gave it two stars because her breath did improve but the side effects weren’t worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Navi Gates

customer_reviews.title: Hill’s Science Diet chicken flavor with oral care
customer_reviews.text: Hill’s Science Diet chicken flavor with oral care. It is one of the few dog foods my dogs actually like eating. It seems to be helping a little bit with their tartar build up too. They have been eating this brand for several months now and have good energy and no stomach issues. I like it so much that I have recently ordered it on the subscription plan.
customer_reviews.author: D. Autrey

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: My MinPin had atrocious breath and plaque galore. I'd had her teeth cleaned at the vet plus removing tartar myself. It didn't help. Vet suggested SD Oral Care and within a month her breath was sooo much better. I didn't feel like gagging when she breathed in my face. Thank goodness its available from places other than the vet's. Amazon's price is very competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life (or at least tooth) saver, for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: Our 9-year-old, 6.75 lb Min-Pin/Chihuahua mix had terrible breath and the beginnings of tooth and gum problems. He absolutely refused to let us brush his teeth. This, and use of a dentifrice, was recommended to us. Almost immediately, his breath became sweet smelling and his teeth and gums look great. Just went thru his annual checkup with flying colors. It's also the only dog food that over the course of almost a year, he hasn't gotten tired of.
customer_reviews.author: 2sapoton

customer_reviews.title: My dog is happy plus no more bad breath
customer_reviews.text: My dog quit eating and the vet didn’t know why. Had a hills science diet food and tried three different brands and flavors. Thought I’d try this for his teeth and literally magically stated eating. He secretly thinks these are treats though so that might help. He loves it and is eating. I’m happy! Plus it helps his breath which use to smell like he puked ate it puked it up and it was just awful killer breath.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Oral Care works wonders for our Shih Tzu's teeth
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this product because of the reviews I read saying it was great for taking the plaque off their dogs teeth. It has helped my Bella's (Shih Tzu) teeth. It has helped so much! She thinks they're a treat! I give her 4-5/day. Her vet was very pleased how much less plaque there was.
customer_reviews.author: Santa_Cruz_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Dog Became EXTREMELY Sick
customer_reviews.text: My rat terrier became extremely sick after eating this food. She started heaving, vomiting, and became extremely lethargic. I did not at first realize the food caused this until it happened twice (both times after eating). She has never reacted this way to any other dog food. I will NEVER buy this food again. My other dog eats a different type of Hill Science, and I'm really considering switching that food as well at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be very tasty but the kibble is HUGE.
customer_reviews.text: My vet nutritionist recommended these due to my dogs dental issues. In my opinion, these kibbles are HUGE. My 54 lb Basset has a hard time chewing to begin with and these definitely pose a challenge. She does really like them, however, will not eat them when mixed with her wet food (probably because they make it tough for her to chow down easily). So these will be broken up into smaller pieces and used as treats. As a result the 28 lb bag I bought may last about 10 or 20 years 😳.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Perera

customer_reviews.title: Large size and hard as a rock
customer_reviews.text: Mini dachshund could not chew at all SO GOT SHARP KNIFE to cut in half and that didn't work SO USED HAMMER TO TRY TO GET PIECES SMALL ENOUGH FOR Peanut to eat. Will have to get former brand and see if expensive stuff can be eaten by 50 lb border collie mix.
customer_reviews.author: Walt's boy Herb

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep teeth clean
customer_reviews.text: I dole these out to my 20 pounder as lunch (he gets three) and dog treats for good behavior while being groomed — to help keep his teeth clean. They are a mouthful for him. He loves them so I assume the flavor is good. Many dog treats are too hard for him but this dog food is perfect and seems to be doing the job (along with a little teeth scraping - for tolerating which he gets piece )
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: These are great for treats
customer_reviews.text: I have four large dogs, and I can't afford to feed Science Diet for their regular food. But we noticed that our vet uses this dog food for treats, and we thought, "Why not?" The individual pieces are pretty large for dog food, but make perfect size treats and our dogs love the taste. The fact that they are supposed to be good for their teeth is a plus, too.
customer_reviews.author: Muddybuddy

customer_reviews.title: Large kibble good for teeth
customer_reviews.text: Just got for my doodle, large pieces! I have been trying to transition from her old food, but it's too easy for her to pick out the large pieces and avoid her old food. Hope this will help with dental health, I'll review once she is fully transitioned!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Less plaque buildup on back molars Wish I used sooner
customer_reviews.text: This product will clean your dogs teeth. My dog eats maybe 3 kibbles a day and his teeth looks remarkably better. I make sure to give my dog a small dinner so he eats them. It’s more work for the dog to chomp thru these large kibbles The vet said it costs 2k to clean his teeth. I wish I would have used this product sooner
customer_reviews.author: b from havertown

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Breath for my Pups
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this & it helps keep their teeth clean & their breath fresh. This is a pretty high calorie food according to my vet. We had to drastically reduce the amount my one overweight dog gets in order to keep her on her weight loss track. My two small dogs get this just as a treat because the chunks are so big. They love it for treats.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie Delana

customer_reviews.title: Too big for small dogs and hard for them to eat
customer_reviews.text: I have small dogs and this food is much too big for them. They are able to eat it but it takes them a while to chew it up. They liked it at first now they don't want to eat. I have broken the large bits up so they will eat but one of my dogs is still reluctant at times. I have to use a hammer to break it io and it takes 2-3 whacks per piece. I can see why my dogs don't want to eat. I'm disappointed that Science Diet even offers this poor quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Ku Hunley

customer_reviews.title: large size pieces helps my dog eat slowly.
customer_reviews.text: My small dog likes this, but they are very, very large pieces, like an inch round, so Eddie doesn’t choke on them, he eats slowly and cannot inhale multiple pieces at once, as he often does with small pet food nibbles. He likes the taste, but truthfully he is not a fussy eater. I think his breath may be a little improved.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jersey Shore

customer_reviews.title: My picky eater loves the flavour
customer_reviews.text: My super-picky dog balks at most teeth-cleaning chewies and toys (his annual dental cleaning is expensive), and is quite particular about food flavour. He's not crazy about the big kibble. Not.At.All. Then again, I didn't expect he would be...his extreme underbite prefers tiny bites. However comma...he finds the flavour so enticingly palatable that he eats it more readily than smaller kibble he likes less (like lamb...don't even). I can see that the slight workout his jaws get will be beneficial as he ages. For those of you worried about the large nugget size, you might be surprised. Certainly worth a try...I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Tee King

customer_reviews.title: Use them for treats or regular meal.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs like this food well enough to be able to use as treats. The amount of this food required to make an entire meal doesn’t make this type of food feasible as a full time meal. However it can be used as an occasional meal. I prefer to simply use them as treats. The fortunately they are probably too big for small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: PetRescuer

customer_reviews.title: Very Big
customer_reviews.text: Way too hard for my dogs..if these were 1⁄2 the size they would be perfect as my dogs ( both around 20#s) do like the way they taste, and that’s a lot! Considering I have the pickiest dogs on earth! Lol, true! I had to do what another reviewer said they did and ‘break them up with the hammer’ ..that won’t do ‘long term’ though, so I will be trying a different kibble made by ‘science diet’ since they liked the taste of these.
customer_reviews.author: PamelaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely not. The kibble is HUGE! Like, I’m talking the size of two marbles combined! My mini dachshund looked at this and never ate it. It was not nice to throw away this expensive dog food right away. Really think of your dog would eat kibble that large! Oh, and I tried crushing it and it’s ridiculously hard to crush. Maybe with a meat tenderizer...
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: My dogs refuse to eat other kibble
customer_reviews.text: My dogs go crazy for this stuff! Although the kibble looks too big for small dogs, my 6.75 lb is able to handle it -- no problem. Yes, it takes her a lot longer to finish her meal, but she loves the stuff. My other dog, a 15 lb 10 year old, also loves it. When I take him to the vet, they're always impressed that his teeth are healthy for an older dog! I've actually tried changing their food to smaller kibble, but they will pick these parts out of the bowl and leave the other stuff behind. I love this dog food, and have even written Hill's Science Diet to tell them so!
customer_reviews.author: SRC

customer_reviews.title: My dogs like this food
customer_reviews.text: My dogs like this food. We have used several types of Science Diet from the little bites to tje advanced fitness and switching between them has never upset their stomachs so when I saw the oral care I thought it would be a good addition. The only thing is I did not realize from the packaging that the pieces were so large. I have 2 small dogs under 10 pounds. We ended up just mixing the oral care with the small bites and they like it. They will pull out the oral pieces and bring them to their beds and eat it one at a time. It definitely slows down their eating and they are able to handle the size.
customer_reviews.author: danielle bryant

customer_reviews.title: Yum
customer_reviews.text: These are huge. Dogs love them as treat. I keep a few out and they go through the day but not as a meal. They really are big junks. But I see how they do oral care that way. A small dog takes a while to get one piece chewed away. Smell is delicious and I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Paws and Things

customer_reviews.title: Great to use for dog treats!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these specifically to use as dog treats rather than for their main source of food. The kibble is large so they make the perfect dog treats! Where else can you buy 4 lbs of quality dog treats for under $15? Plus, they're helping to clean your dog's teeth! Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Katlyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Vet Recommend Food
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a super picky eater and I’ve spent years finding a food for her that is Vet recommended that doesn’t upset her stomach. I switched her to this food once the veterinarian told me about the dangers of a grain free diet for large dogs (dilated cardiomyopathy). She loves it and has super regular poops - gross but dog owners understand how important this is. I’m so happy I finally found this food. Plus, her breath has improved.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: Smells horrible and my Aussie still inhales the larger pieces, so that defeats the purpose. Would not recommend as a daily dog food (way better foods out there) but I have had success with the science diet oral care food for cats, so if your dog will actually chew these up it might be worth it to add to their regular food a few times a week or use as treats.
customer_reviews.author: Immagini mama

customer_reviews.title: Easily the largest that I've seen
customer_reviews.text: These are LARGE CHUNKS people, so be aware! Easily the largest that I've seen, as someone else said, they are the size of tater tots! All four of my dogs love them (2 boxers, 2 staffies) and they range between 45 pounds and 87 pounds, from 10 years old to about 2 1/2 years old, and none have problems chewing them. I mix this with another, smaller kibble from Merrick. Though not the best ingredients in the world, my dogs love them and I think it does help a bit with their teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Smith

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this product
customer_reviews.text: I feed my dogs Science Diet Small Breed Adult food daily. About two years ago I stopped buying separate dog treats and started giving them the Science Diet Oral Care as treats. They LOVE it! It's good for their oral health + it saves me a about half over the cost of the dog treats I was giving them previously.
customer_reviews.author: merchantlink

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog teeth
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs love these bites. I notice they are higher calorie so we only supplement their regular food with them rather than use as every day food. I have noticed both dogs have cleaner teeth and better breath since we started feeding them the Oral Care dog food. We have always used Hill's Science diet for our pets and find they have great quality products. Neither dog likes hard chews or dental sticks so this is a great alternative for us.
customer_reviews.author: Emmalene Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Vet Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Even though this was recommended by our vet, we're sticking with brushing our dogs teeth. For the price of the food, it doesn't seem like the best replacement for basic teeth care. The kibbles are a bit large for our small dogs, but they all have no problem with the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Rough Rider

customer_reviews.title: WAY too big for small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a chihuahua and I was recommended these but a vet but I don't think they knew how big the bites were. I gave my dog one and she managed to get it down, but I'm giving them away because I don't want to risk her having a problem getting them down. They are like the size of ping pong balls...
customer_reviews.author: Shae

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them
customer_reviews.text: Thought they where a little to hard on the kids as a meal, but they loved them. So I fed them out as treats. Even this seems to be helping clean their old teeth and they race me to their "candy jar" after meal time. I recommend them in this fashion
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Riney

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by our vet.
customer_reviews.text: The kibble looks like tater tots. They're super crunchy and took my maltipoos a few bites to break the kibble at first. Our vet said there are enzymes that help break down any plaque on their teeth and the crunchy helps scrape the teeth. My babies love this kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Amos

customer_reviews.title: Great for teeth; bad for allergies
customer_reviews.text: So here's the thing it works fabulous, her breath has never been better..... but she's never been as itchier either. The corn, wheat, barley and chicken as the first dominant ingredients make it so that she scratches herself silly. Even giving her a benadryl doesn't help. I love what it's doing for her teeth and breath but it's really sad to see her biting her legs and holes in her fur.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: A+ oral care
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the oral care bites for our dog pack ( of all sizes). We use them as treats. The dogs love them! The treats are given daily several times and help with cleaning the teeth, which improves the dogs breath. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Days

customer_reviews.title: Pieces too big for a small dog to chew
customer_reviews.text: The picture of a small dog on the bag is VERY misleading. The pieces are far too large for my chihuahua to bite down on. He really needs the "oral care" promised so I'm sawing (the pieces are to hard to cut with scissors and I'm afraid to try using a kitchen knife) the nuggets in to 4 smaller pieces which my dog eats and seems to enjoy. I'm using these as a supplement and/or treats daily.
customer_reviews.author: ChocolateChipCookie330

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: I didnt really sniff it so i give sniff 3 stars , but my dog seems to like it. She is a small dog and these are huge bites, but she manages to bite them down. I will be looking for this product in smaller bites if available.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Big size food pellets
customer_reviews.text: I saw the doxie on the bag so I assumed it would be small size dog food but it was rather large. I have a mini doxie and she’s only 8lbs so that might be why it seemed so big, maybe it’s meant for a standard size doxie bigger in stature. I wouldn’t recommend for a small dog it’s more for medium size dogs. Other than that great product!
customer_reviews.author: KobeBasil

customer_reviews.title: Both my dogs love this food!
customer_reviews.text: This is what my vet recommended for my dogs. One of them in particular gets tartar very easily, and has to go in for expensive teeth cleaning now and then. I don’t know yet if this will improve my dogs’ oral health, but I do know they absolutely love this food! They can be picky eaters at times, but this food always gets eaten! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Californiagirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Quantity and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy from petsmart but they only have oral care in the small bags. This is better price and more food so I don't have to go back to pets mart so often. I only have 15lb poodle so I put into another container and refill the other container every so often so the food doesnt get stale from reopening the bag so much. She loves the taste, I love the quality and it helps her rancid breath.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bree

customer_reviews.title: Not for small breeds!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not be misled by the small breed dog on the bag. This dog food is not for small breeds. The dachshund on the package is misleading as these pellets are the size of small meatballs. I have to soak them in hot water and then put them through a food processor for them to be able to eat it.. Lab yes, small dog nah.
customer_reviews.author: ValerieValera

customer_reviews.title: dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: My vet suggested feeding my 2 Boston Terriers oral care dry food. These are nice large chunks (as vet suggested..you want them to chew them up). My dogs love them. They eat them more as a snack. But a few (10 or so) out in bowl once a day. Still feed them their regular kibble.
customer_reviews.author: J. Curran

customer_reviews.title: Great for Teeth
customer_reviews.text: I use this for treats rather than daily diet. It has kept my dog’s teeth tartar free so far. The Vet even mentioned his teeth looked great but he is only 20 mos and will see if that continues to help as he gets older.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Pups love it, big chunks though
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it but they are both small, less than 10 lbs each, and the pieces are very large. I’m sure that helps with the teeth cleaning, but keep that in mind if you have a super small dog.
customer_reviews.author: BooIAM

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small long haired dachshund that loves these. I use them as treats after taking her out for a walk, and since they are "oral care", they're good for her. The locale PetSmart quit carrying this type of Science Diet, and I didn't feel like driving 15 or 20 miles to the next closest pet store, so I searched Amazon, and naturally found them here, and at the same price as PetSmart with no shipping fees. Good Deal!!
customer_reviews.author: EGH923

customer_reviews.title: Dog both likes and tolerates this food
customer_reviews.text: We use this product for dog food that also keeps teeth healthy. Our dog enjoys this product - she will grab a nugget and bring it to favorite spots near where we are in the house and crunch it up. And it seems to do a good job of keeping her teeth healthy. We like it so much that we have a standing order.
customer_reviews.author: M S

customer_reviews.title: No help for breath.
customer_reviews.text: The one positive about this food is that my dog loves it. When we were mixing it for transition with her old food, she picked around and refused to eat the old... so she is certainly happy. Unfortunately, it shows absolutely no improvement in her breath and we are 3 bags in... and it gives her gas... so now the odor is on both ends. No plans of changing food at this point... but disappointed in the results. Also, unless I’m just not finding it... I wish there were smaller bites for smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Lyndaker

customer_reviews.title: The Best for The Best
customer_reviews.text: Maybe half the size of a ping pong ball, I keep them in a cookie jar and offer them as rewards throughout the day. Most treats need to be somewhat limited, in my opinion, but I give him all of these that he wins (which is a lot). He still eats enough of his regular SD food which is available at all times. I love him a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Judge Jodi Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: ... weary of them choking but my goodness they absolutely love this. I have them eating another Science Diet ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of just the size because my Chiweenie and Brusells mix are small sized dogs and I was weary of them choking but my goodness they absolutely love this. I have them eating another Science Diet one but this morning the both nudged the bowls (refusing to eat) until I switched to the oral care chicken one. I did watch them to make sure nothing happened but I'm honestly happy that they like not only the brand but the meal option. In time I hope it helps with their oral care as both breeds are prone to dental issues. I am a new loyal fan to Hill's Science Diet.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Soto

customer_reviews.title: Way to huge for a small adult dog RIP OFF
customer_reviews.text: How’s this meant for a small adult dog the kibble is HUGEEEE my yorkie can’t even chew it , this is literally false advertising how can u have a small dog breed even on the cover. If I had known it was so big I would’ve never gotten this package!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this kibble for my 13 yr old Corgi who has problems with his teeth. I think he's too old to be anesthetized to get his teeth cleaned any more and I don't have much luck brushing his teeth very well. I think this food helps clean his teeth. It also makes him chew his food more. He tends to just swallow smaller kibble whole! My Corgi is 34 lbs. My 6 lb Papillon also loves these large kibbles. I think it has healthy ingredients for any dog, but it would not be appropriate for a dog with chewing problems. I think it is well worth the cost and the subscription service is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I have fed this to my dogs for around 17 years if not longer. They have all loved it. Does it help the teeth? It definitely can't hurt that my 8 lb babies have to chew each piece before swallowing. Would be nice to have a medium size bag again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Occasionally like a Lego
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these "nuggets". Only problem is he will leave these around occasionally. If you have ever stepped in a Lego, then you know what I'm talking about. Other than that, this is a great food.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie K.

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves This Food
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Blue Buffalo when my dogs breath was getting stinky and he loves this food. I have to admit, from a human standpoint, it does look more appetizing and smells better. I have a big dog and these are big chunks, not little pellets. His breath improved too.
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Photo - Not Appropriate for Small Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of Hill's Science Diet products, but the small dog pictured on the bag is misleading. I bought this for my 8 lb. poodle mix, and when it arrived, I was surprised by the size of the kibble. Each one is almost the size of a ping pong ball! No way a small dog would be able to eat this, so I'm not sure why there's a small dog pictured on the bag. I ended up donating it to a local shelter.
customer_reviews.author: YSBnow

customer_reviews.title: Good for larger size dogs
customer_reviews.text: Medium and small dog seem to like the food (they're not picky eaters) but the bites are some of the biggest I have ever seen in my 25+ years of dog ownership. Will be switching back to small bites.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Size of Tater Tots
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this food but it's too big for them to eat as their main dish. So we use them more as treats since the food looks like tater tots.
customer_reviews.author: Tat

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HEALTHY TREAT AS WELL AS FOOD!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this as a snack for my dog for awhile now. She loves the little balls, and I know they are healthy for her. They store easily, and I keep a small container of them on my kitchen counter so that they are readily available for rewards. When they come to my house, my friends also know where to get treats for the dog. Just don't leave the balls in your walking path as they may cause you to trip. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lectio Veritas

customer_reviews.title: Great for treats too!
customer_reviews.text: My little pack loves these. I use them as a healthy treat. It takes my youngest girl (3 yrs : 13 lbs) about two solid minutes to actually eat it. The older dogs will gnaw on them around 4 minutes. Even my picky water loves these and will run to the couch and hop on to eat her *treat* alone. This is the first dog food that all 6 will eat.
customer_reviews.author: NJHS

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs who need to slow their eating.
customer_reviews.text: This particular foid was recommended for one of our dogs who eats so fast he doesn't seem to notice when he's had enough. The larger chunks require him to slow down and chew. He has done so much better on this food. He looks great, has dropped some unneeded weight, is far more content with feeding and his teeth look great as well. The kibble is large enough to be used as treats; all the dogs love it, even the smaller ones love it for a treat. You feed less of this kibble if you follow the guides, so it's quite affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Freshens breath and the dogs loved it too!
customer_reviews.text: My two miniature dachshunds loved this food! It comes in large nuggets that I’m assuming act similar to greenies as they chew them up. Wish it was grain free.
customer_reviews.author: Knut Lovhoiden

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food to freshen breath
customer_reviews.text: I am SO GRATEFUL that I found this food. My 7 lb chihuahua loves it and it’s made a significant difference in freshening her breath and therefore her dental health. I only give her 5 nuggets per day and that does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Our Miniature Schnauzer liked it immediately
customer_reviews.text: Our five year old Miniature Schnauzer loves the Oral Care dog food, a recommendation of his vet. He liked it immediately. We had no difficulty getting him to accept this new daily food.
customer_reviews.author: Lally

customer_reviews.title: More then meets needs
customer_reviews.text: I found the product to be in very good condition, not all busted up. It seems to be fresher then with I find locally. The dogs like it which is most important, and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Guzowsky

customer_reviews.title: fussy pup loves this....can even use as a treat
customer_reviews.text: My fussy dogs eat this and Kirkland Puppy in a mix - they love both and have typically refused most dry dog food - it's not their fault, they are used to getting treated with rotisserie chicken or real liver cooked especially for them by Mom, so how can dry food compete but I have have tried many - very expensive & natural brands and these are the only ones they will eat....not really sure if it helps their teeth but it was recommended to me by my vet after my dogs dental cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Bitey'sMom

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Great, really does improve dental health
customer_reviews.text: My 3 small dogs (9-12 lb.) love it. The kibble is large, which takes more work for dogs to eat. But it also helps their teeth that it is larger. The vet was amazed by how good their teeth were, especially since small dogs tend to have dental problems. He hadn't heard of it, even though he carries Hill's, and will recommend it now to other clients.
customer_reviews.author: LibertyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Addictive for my Poodles.
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by my veterinarian for oral health. I do not use it as daily feed (one of my adopted poodles has only 2 teeth and I prepare a food recommended by the MSPCA, ground meat with brown rice and sweet potates with other seasonal vegetables). Instead, it is a treat food and I have "treat balls" purchased through Amazon. These balls provide entertainment and activity as well as a rewarding treat. I do not recall who makes the treat balls, but they are orange and come in several sizes. Unfortunately, I often find myself sleeping with the treat balls. No point in letting them get out of view!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Small dogs will swallow these whole. Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: Was told to get this by my vet for my 20 pound dog. The idea is that these pieces are so big they will chew them up. But he was swallowing them whole. Very expensive and it was a massive waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Billy24

customer_reviews.title: Hope it helps with tarter control
customer_reviews.text: My Pom seems to do well with this food. He really has to work to chew it and seems to like the taste well enough. And his stool is a better consistency than with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: FRW

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than you would think.  I will use them as treats!
customer_reviews.text: Interestingly enough, my dog liked these right away! I was surprised how large they are compared to his small bites food. Well he took all of them, one by one, and stashed them in his bed. Didn’t eat them. But they are hidden away. Had to buy more small bites. Will use these as treats if I can break them up!
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: Though you can use this as your dog's main diet, I use it as a healthy snack. I fill their bowl with dog food, then add several of these on top, as I am leaving for work. They love to run over to the bowl, get one, then run away with their prize! Keeps them busy and is a healthy snack, and keeps them occupied when I have left for work. ( I have dogs that share food well). My vet tells me it's is great for their teeth.
customer_reviews.author: shandelu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Will be ordering again! The pieces of food are large and my dog has to chew well with her back teeth which has been a problem previously. And it's made with a more "spongy" texture that i can see goes all over her teeth while chewing. We got this small bag just to offer as treats to try it out and she LOVES them!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Taylor

customer_reviews.title: My doxie likes it, kibbles are gigantic.
customer_reviews.text: My dachshund likes it, BUT why on earth are the kibbles giant gum ball sized??? It’s ridiculous. She still eats it, it just makes no sense for small breed dog why they are so huge.
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: Works so well. Clean dog breathe
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these so much she turns her nose up at her other dog food. Really solved her breathe problem far better than those expensive green chews.
customer_reviews.author: EthanJ

customer_reviews.title: Good food helps clean dogs teeth
customer_reviews.text: Helps keep my dogs teeth a little cleaner. I have dachshunds and they have awful teeth. This helps with the tarter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love to see improvement in my dog oral care
customer_reviews.text: I love to see improvement in my dog oral care. I had problem with giving too many cleaning snack and very often he didn't like them. He eat's this food which is success. I am mixing it with other food, and i still see improvement in his mouth. He's plug is much smaller then it was just after one pack, I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: urszula

customer_reviews.title: Big kibble but it works
customer_reviews.text: My dog's breath wasn't really that bad but he gets some stinky treats but after eating this food (which he loved) his breath is already better. Now the kibble is huge but that's the point.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Love it! It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Oral Care that totally works. My dog's dragon breath is a thing of the past after I started her on this diet. It has also helped her slow down her eating. The bigger kibbles take her longer to chew.
customer_reviews.author: JVW

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves it
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how much it helps my miniature dachshund's teeth, but he loves the food. He has been on it for about 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Julietta

customer_reviews.title: A Great Formula For the Speed Eater And Good Taste Too Apparently
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for our newest 39lb rescue who gulps his food with abandon! Between his slo-food bowl and the sheer size of this kibble he is no longer a vomit comet after his (3) meals everyday. Unexpectedly though, this kibble is favored by our oldest dog. She lacks her largest upper molars on both sides but that doesn't stop her from picking it out of her dish over the SD Light. She still eats both and manages this formula just fine despite it's size.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Use for a treat!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for bedtime snacks. I have 2 chihuahuas, a 40# mixed breed and a dane. They are cheaper than regular treats, my dogs love them, and they are good for their teeth. I get one bag, give them nightly and the bag lasts me about 2 months
customer_reviews.author: tumyeto32

customer_reviews.title: Huge pieces not suitable for little dogs
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased these for my 5 pound Yorkie because he starting to have problems with his teeth and to my surprise when I opened the bag they are ginormous pieces. I tried to give him one but it literally just fits in his mouth and he spits it out and won’t even chew it because it’s so big. I definitely was not expecting them to be that big I highly recommend putting the size of the pieces on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Basiorka

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This actually worked well but the pieces of food are so large they are difficult for my 20 lb dog to chew. Great for a larger dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kbeth

customer_reviews.title: Keeps teeth in excellent condition
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor told me about this product. They have a 13 year old dog with the whitest no tarter teeth I have ever seen. Since we got the food I give my dog 2 kibbles a day and already her teeth are showing improvement. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

product_meta.title: Hill's Science Diet Dry Dog Food, Adult Oral Care for Dental Health Dog Food, Chicken Rice & Barley Recipe
product_meta.description:
Size:4 LB BagDog dental health affects so much more than just the teeth. Help support overal health and vitality in your adult dog with Hill's Science Diet Oral Care Adult Dog Food. Designed with a unique, clinically proven interlocking fiber technology, this unique kibble works to clean dog teeth and freshen breath with every bite. Plus, this premium dog food made with natural ingredients is packed with Omega-6 fatty acids & Vitamin E to help your grown dog keep a healthy coat and skin each and every day. This recipe is formulated with decades of cutting-edge research to be a great-tasting dog food your adult dog can truly enjoy. There’s more to love with the new look of Science Diet. Some of our products also have new names, new kibble shapes & new formulas. Not recommended for puppies and pregnant or nursing dogs

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Hill’s Pet Nutrition’s Mission: To help enrich and lengthen the special relationships between people and their pets.

More than 220 veterinarians, food scientists, technicians and Ph.D. nutritionists at Hill's develop all of Hill's pet foods to meet the needs of your pets. Hill’s only accepts ingredients from suppliers whose facilities meet stringent quality standards and who are approved by Hill's. Not only is each ingredient examined to ensure its safety, we also analyze each product's ingredient profile for essential nutrients to ensure your pet gets the stringent, precise formulation they need.

Hill’s uses only high-quality ingredients including real chicken, lamb or salmon protein. Hill’s dry pet foods have quality protein as the first ingredient and provide clinically proven antioxidant benefits. Plus, they’re made with natural ingredients (plus vitamins, minerals & amino acids) and never contain artificial colors, flavors, preservatives or chicken by-product meal.

Hill’s Food, Shelter & Love program donates food to shelters across the country, providing the proper nutrition that helps pets find their way to loving homes. With every purchase of Science Diet you help feed over 100,000 homeless pets every day, 365 days a year.
feature_bullets: This dry dog food helps improve the dental health of your grown canine
Interlocking fiber technology cleans canine teeth and supports fresh breath with every bite
A dog food with Omega-6 fatty acids & Vitamin E for healthy skin and coat
Made in the USA with Global ingredients you can trust
Helps reduce plaque & tartar build-up with clinically proven kibble technology

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
